description: Everything you need to know about the birth of Meghan Markle and Prince Harry’s baby.
title: The Royal Baby: Frequently Asked Questions
title_page: The Royal Baby: Frequently Asked Questions - The New York Times
maintext:
13 Why might Prince Harry not want his child to have a title?
His own seems to chafe. In a 2017 interview with Newsweek, Prince Harry displayed both a marked lack of enthusiasm for royal duties (“Is there any one of the royal family who wants to be king or queen? I don’t think so, but we will carry out our duties at the right time”) and a keen awareness of his diminishing public importance (“I feel there is just a smallish window when people are interested in me before [William’s children] take over, and I’ve got to make the most of it.”). These sentiments, coupled with years of reports that the royal family intends to become laser-focused on the sovereign’s immediate successors, leaves open the possibility that Prince Harry’s heirs could go titleless at his request.
Harry’s cousin, Princess Anne’s daughter Zara Tindall, has expressed her gratitude at being allowed to eschew the royal obligations and scrutiny a title entails, and instead simply be very wealthy.
